definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

nothing sadder than a withered heart (idiom attributed to Confucius by Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])/no greater sorrow than a heart that never rejoices/the worst sorrow is not as bad as an uncaring heart/nothing is more wretched than apathy
pinyin: ai1 mo4 da4 yu2 xin1 si3

definition: If one can change after making a mistake, there is nothing better (idiom)
pinyin: guo4 er2 neng2 gai3 , shan4 mo4 da4 yan1

sentences.english: To be around the medalists was a great honour.
sentences.chinese: 能爲獲得獎牌而奮鬥本身就是一種莫大的榮譽。

sentences.english: I am prodigiously proud of him.
sentences.chinese: 我真爲他感到莫大的驕傲。

sentences.english: Looked that two pure performing skills send the actor wind play are really greatest enjoyments .
sentences.chinese: 看兩位純粹演技派演員飆戲真是莫大的享受。

sentences.english: She considered being an assistant to Professor Lin as a great honor .
sentences.chinese: 她認爲能當劉教授的助手是莫大的榮譽。

sentences.english: Mo once again that I how great sin.
sentences.chinese: 墨玉再次覺得本人罪莫大焉。

sentences.english: The tragedy of freedom is the evangel for its enemy.
sentences.chinese: 如題自由的災難是自由敵人的莫大喜訊。

sentences.english: What activities give you the most joy?
sentences.chinese: 哪些工作給你帶來莫大的樂趣？

sentences.english: Eating chocolate brings Sally great pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 喫巧克力給賽莉帶來了莫大的享受。

sentences.english: It's our greated honor to have the opportunity to work with your respectable company.
sentences.chinese: 能有機會與貴司合作是我們莫大的榮幸。

sentences.english: Rushworth being obliged to yield to Lady Bertram's staying at home, could only be sorry.
sentences.chinese: 伯特倫夫人不能跟着一起去，這是莫大的欠缺。

sentences.english: Knowledge, often to small, but great weakness, and strong ear.
sentences.chinese: 養生之道，常欲小勞，但莫大疲，及強所不能耳。

sentences.english: Their action and attitude had greatly honored the victims.
sentences.chinese: 他們的行動和態度給了犧牲者莫大的榮譽。

sentences.english: Two samples of the bilingual calligraphy devised by Mr David Moser.
sentences.chinese: 上面是美國的莫大偉先生設計的雙語書法的兩份樣圖。

sentences.english: Now I have the greatest honour to say a few words to my people.
sentences.chinese: 這裏我懷着莫大的榮幸對我的人民說上幾句話。

sentences.english: A short saying oft contains much wisdom. Aletes.
sentences.chinese: 簡簡單單一句話，常包含着莫大的智慧。

sentences.english: Every proof of confidence in you is a great opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 每一份對你的信任，對你都是一次莫大的機會。

definition: favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
how old?/how big?/how much?/so big/that much
it goes without saying/it is self-evident
just as/no less than/like (sth momentous)/as good as/tantamount to
